episodes.title: #2: How to Lead in The Age of Intelligent Machines & The Rise of the 'More Human' Economy, Featuring World-Renowned NYT Best-Selling Author and CEO Dov Seidman
episodes.summary:
Dov Seidman is a world-renowned New York Times best-selling author and CEO of LRN. Praised by Fortune Magazine as the “hottest advisor on the corporate virtue circuit,” Dov has built a career around the idea that the most principled businesses are the most profitable and sustainable. In this illuminating discussion, Dov shares surprising insights from his research on the role trust, purpose and values play in a world where machines can now out-think, out-process and out-perform us. 

 

According to Dov, the world is being reshaped and faster than we’ve been able to reshape ourselves, including our institutions, our businesses, and our leadership. The implications are profound and the imperatives are moral in nature. This episode is an amazing opportunity for rising leaders and entrepreneurs to learn how to survive and thrive in what Dov calls a "More Human Economy". The technological revolution of the 21st century is as consequential as the scientific revolution, he argues, and it is “forcing us to answer a most profound question — one we’ve never had to ask before: ‘What does it mean to be human in the age of intelligent machines?’” The answer, according to Dov, evolves around the one thing machines will never have: “a heart.” 

 

Please enjoy our conversation with Dov Seidman. And remember to visit www.IVY.com to enjoy access to a lifetime of learning, growth, and impact through in-person collaborations with world-class leaders, thinkers, and institutions.

episodes.title: #1: How to Find Your Passion, Get Millions of Followers, and Shape Reality with Tim Urban, Founder of Wait But Why
episodes.summary:
Tim Urban is the author of the popular blog "Wait but Why". Tim is the master of taking big — literally astronomical — questions, and bringing them back down to earth. His blog has attracted millions of readers, thousands of patrons, and famous fans like Tesla CEO Elon Musk, TED Curator Chris Anderson, and Twitter co-founder Evan Williams. Combining long-form prose with wry stick-figure illustrations, "Wait But Why" covers everything from procrastination and artificial intelligence to happiness and why we haven’t yet encountered aliens.

 

Last month, Tim spoke to the IVY community about “The Power of Creative Thinking.” He also sat down for an in-depth discussion with IVY’s Co-Founder, Beri Meric, covering topics from how to build a career doing what you love and how to find your audience on the internet; to the future of human consciousness and how to build a perfect holographic simulation of the universe.

 

Please enjoy our conversation with Tim Urban. And remember to visit www.IVY.com to enjoy access to a lifetime of learning, growth, and impact through in-person collaborations with world-class leaders, thinkers, and institutions.
